definition.name: NXlockin
definition.doc: Base classes definition for lock in devices.

group.name: hardware
group.doc: Hardware manufacturers and type of lockin amplifier.

By mixing the input signal (STS signal) with the modulated signal (such as Bias) and comparing it with the reference signal, they are enhanced and the effects of noise interference are reduced, resulting in more accurate measurements.

field.name: bias_divider
field.doc: if Lock-in -- Bias Divider 1/10 or 1/100, Bias divider = V(ref)/[V(ref)+V(input)]

field.name: modulation_status
field.doc: Switch the lock-in moulation on or off.

field.name: modulation_signal
field.doc: A modulation signal (such as bias, current et.al.) is a periodic voltage signal, usually applied to the surface of a sample, which serves to modify the physical properties of the sample surface and generate weak AC current signals that can be detected and analysed by instruments such as lock-in amplifiers.

field.name: modulation_amplitude
field.doc: Sets the amplitude (in physical units of the modulated signal) of the sine modulation.

field.name: modulation_frequency
field.doc: Sets the frequency of the sine modulation added to the signal to modulate.

field.name: demodulated_signal
field.doc: The input signal (STS signal) will be demodulated, in order to determine the amplitude and phase at the frequency set in the Frequency field or harmonics, such as current, bias, et.al.

field.name: number_of_demodulator_channels
field.doc: The number of signals which will be demodulated.

field.name: low_pass
field.doc: Order and cut-off frequency of the low-pass filter applied on the demodulated signals (X,Y). Cut-off frq (low pass filter) (foreach DemodulatorChannels)

field.name: hi_pass
field.doc: Order and cut-off frequency of the high-pass filter applied on the demodulation signal. Cut-off frq (hi pass filter) (foreach DemodulatorChannels)

field.name: lp_filter_cutoff
field.doc: Sets the cut-off frequency of the low-pass filter (affects the displayed TC (s) value) for D1. The filter is applied to the demodulated signals (X,Y).

field.name: lp_filter_order
field.doc: Order and cut-off frequency of the low-pass filter applied on the demodulated signals (X,Y). Reducing the bandwidth or increasing the order reduces noise on the demodulated signals, but will require longer settling and measurement times.

field.name: hp_filter_cutoff
field.doc: Sets the cut-off frequency of the high-pass filter (affects the displayed TC (s) value) for D1. The filter is applied to the demodulated signals (X,Y).

field.name: hp_filter_order
field.doc: Order and cut-off frequency of the high-pass filter applied on the demodulation signal of D!. This is used mainly to suppress a DC component of the demodulation signal, which would lead to a component at modulation frequency in the demodulated signals.

field.name: sync
field.doc: Switch on/off the Sync filter on the demodulated signals (X,Y) on or off. (foreach DemodulatorChannels)

field.name: ref_phase_N
field.doc: Reference phase for the sine on the demodulated signal with respect to the modulation signal. (foreach DemodulatorChannels)

field.name: integration_time
field.doc: Time during which the data are acquired and averaged. (for the input filter)

field.name: harmonic_order_N
field.doc: The order of the harmonic oscillation to detect on the demodulated signals. (with respect to the modulation frequency)

field.name: sensitivity_factor
field.doc: Ratio of output signal amplitude to input signal amplitue (V/V). (input gain)
